meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, the kids were tuckered out and ready for bed.
meanings.sent2: She felt tuckered after running a marathon.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was tuckered from chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The old car sputtered to a stop, tuckered from the long journey.
meanings.sent5: The students were tuckered after studying for their exams all night.

meanings.definition: To tire out or wear out.
meanings.sent1: The long hike tuckered him out, and he needed to rest.
meanings.sent2: Playing soccer in the sun can really tucker you out.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fix the broken machine tuckered him out more than he expected.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise of the city tuckered her out by the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The intense workout tuckered out even the fittest athletes.

meanings.definition: To be completely worn out or depleted.
meanings.sent1: The food supplies were tuckered after the long winter.
meanings.sent2: The batteries were tuckered and needed to be replaced.
meanings.sent3: The tired horse was tuckered after pulling the heavy cart all day.
meanings.sent4: The old house was tuckered and needed renovations.
meanings.sent5: The phone battery was tuckered and died in the middle of the call.
